intro: Thrixspermum insularum, commonly known as the island thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to specific island regions in the Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils, adapting to saline and well-drained environments. Its small, five-petaled flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited geographic distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
